doc.repnme: Bilan sur sept pays africains : Délégation de gestion du service d’eau en milieu rural et semi urbain
doc.abstracts: This paper reviews the delegation of management of water service for networks of water supply schemes (AEP) in rural and semi urban areas in seven countries: Benin, Burkina Faso, Mali, Mauritania, Niger, Rwanda and Senegal. The purpose of the document is to identify key lessons and success factors that can be learned from the first generation of delegations of management conducted in rural areas and small centers, to guide countries in implementing action plans for the generalization of this approach. AEP Networks play an increasingly more strategic role in the water supply since it provides coverage for at least one quarter of the population living in rural areas and in small centers. In this context, the delegation of management is a logical alternative to the model community management and opens up the private sector in order to improve the sustainability of water service. A unified framework for intervention is proposed to go towards more sustainable water services, organized in four conceptual blocks: improving practice management delegation; enabling environment for management; capacity building of actors; and tools and information services.
